benchmark_details.name: NCEN-QA
benchmark_details.overview: NCEN-QA is a new dataset in finance for benchmarking question-answering tasks derived from N-CEN reports on funds. It serves as a robust platform for evaluating automatic workflow generation systems in handling question-answering tasks related to funds.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of NCEN-QA is to evaluate workflow generation systems in finance, particularly for question-answering tasks using data from N-CEN reports.

data.source: Data is sourced from N-CEN reports filed by registered investment companies available on the public database Edgar from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
data.annotation: Manually created question-answer pairs based on information extracted from N-CEN reports.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by comparing generated answers to ground truth, with specific criteria for entity names and numerical values.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in generating correct answers to the posed questions.
methodology.baseline_results: The proposed methods significantly outperformed baseline methods like GPT-Context-Retrieval.
methodology.validation: Performance is validated through thorough experiments against standard methodologies and ablation studies on the dataset.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: FlowMind ensures that LLMs do not directly interact with proprietary data, thus protecting data integrity.
